metadata.Title: CVE-2019-5849 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Out of bounds read in Skia in Google Chrome prior to 75.0.3770.80 allowed aremote attacker to obtain potentially sensitive information from processmemory via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5849` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 75.0.3770.90-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 75.0.3770.90-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 75.0.3770.90-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 75.0.3770.90-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 75.0.3770.90-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

firefox - 69.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 69.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 69.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '75.0.3770.90-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '69.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
